title: LLMs aren't even as smart as dogs, says Meta's AI chief scientist
description: LeCun also said not to fear an AI takeover because 'there is no correlation between being smart and wanting to take over.'

title: How to access, install, and use AI ChatGPT-4 plugins (and why you should)
description: ChatGPT-3.5 is useful. ChatGPT-4 can be very useful. But, for the most useful version of ChatGPT to date, you need to add, implement, and use ChatGPT-4 with plugins.

title: Even Google is warning its employees about AI chatbot use
description: Think before you chat with ChatGPT, Google Bard, Bing Chat, or any other AI chatbot.

title: Twitch announces a new program to help streamers make more money
description: Some Twitch streamers could be eligible for a new more favorable revenue split. But there are several things worth noting.

title: ChatGPT-powered voice commands are coming to Mercedes-Benz cars
description: If you own a Mercedes-Benz, your ChatGPT usage can now seamlessly expand to your car. Here's how.

title: Lenovo Yoga Book 9i review: A dual-screen laptop before its time, and I'm here for it
description: The dual-screen laptop goes all-in on touchscreen inputs and packs plenty of performance, but all that innovation comes at a cost - and a learning curve.

title: 5 ways to say no to pointless meetings
description: There are few things worse than a calendar full of back-to-back meetings. Here's how to make it stop.

title: Is humanity really doomed? Consider AI's Achilles heel
description: AI is here to stay, but no matter what developers and businesses think, it's not perfect. In fact, it has one glaring inadequacy that it will never surmount.

title: How to vastly improve sound on Linux with EasyEffects
description: If you're looking to enhance the quality of sound you hear on the Linux operating system, EasyEffects is the simplest way to go.

title: The US government buys your user data. Here's what it does with it
description: A declassified report confirms for the first time that the US government purchases Americans' personal information from third-party data brokers. Here's what you need to know about it.
